name: 1994! "Fuck It" LP/PHOTOBOOK
description: On what was meant to be their final UK tour, 1994! wound up recording what would become a new LP that would serve as the impetus for the band to continue on.  Recorded themselves using an iphone and a knock off sm58 microphone, the record is intended to work as one piece of music, not as separate tracks. The result is a brilliantly minimalist but powerful recording. This release finds the band moving towards more abstract song structures but still retaining the mathy revolution summer-esque punk rock you've come to expect from Lancaster's favorite sons. The record comes on two different vinyl colors and includes a gorgeous 12 page 11x11 photo book.

name: ANTILLES/STAPH "split" test press
description: hand numbered #3 out of 5 copies

name: RAW NERVES "we must be dreaming" test press
description: hand numbered #3 out of 5 copies

name: Beau Navire | Lumens LP
description: "Lumens" is Beau Navire's second full length release and will surely serve as a genre defining staple in hardcore. Building upon the raw emotion, nervous melodies and epic crescendos of their previous releases, "Lumens" demonstrates a maturity in song writing that finds Beau Navire crafting a perfect storm of chaos, the influence of bands line Funeral Diner, Neil Perry, The Pine etc can still be heard but they have built off of that sound to create a unique and emotional record that is saturated with originality. In stock now!

name: Nö Pöwer | No Axis 7"
description: Members of Grids and Obstruction deliver a raw, four song blast of feedback soaked dbeat hardcore punk. Taking cues from classic Japanese hardcore and more modern Spanish bands like Invasion or Destino Final, these North Carolina ragers have outdone themselves on this, their fourth release, after previously releasing two cassettes and a 7 inch. This might be the loudest record we've ever released. This is a split release with Self Aware records so we will only have limited copies available. Only 300 pressed.

name: Beau Navire/Republic of Dreams | Split 7"EP
description:
Oakland's BEAU NAVIRE, comprised of members of Loma Prieta and various other Bay Area bands, deliver their best material to date following a slew of releases in only a little over a year and non-stop playing up and down the west coast as well as a european tour. They bring a nervous violence to their heartfelt brand of chaotic hardcore which uniquely plays out in their songwriting. Reminiscent of bands like Neil Perry, Funeral Diner etc.
Germany's REPUBLIC OF DREAMS is made up of members of Louise Cyphre and play absolutely frantic, feedback-drenched punk at a nonstop breakneck pace without sacrificing an ounce of melody for the chaos. Fans of Raein and other European screamo bands take note. US tour planned this year. 
Diecut covers and colored vinyl to boot, this was a split release between ourselves and a few other labels so we only will have limited copies available!

name: 1994! "fckyrhed" reissue LP
description:
The first press of this record went so fast that Inkblot and Square of Opposition decided to repress it. The reissue has new silkscreened covers, new inserts etc. For those who don't know, On their third release and second full length, Lancaster PA duo 1994! continue to develop their revolution summer influenced hyperactive post hardcore sound. While still delivering the frantic, anthemic punk that they are known for, 1994! shows a bit of progression on this record at times to a more controlled and melodic sound, demonstrating influences ranging from Dinosaur Jr to Braid or Cap'n Jazz while still holding onto the basic framework of their style.
Only 500 of these are pressed. Each label will have about 200 copies available. Don't miss out on it. DVDs are temporarily out of stock! Record available only!

name: 1994! | Fckyrhed LP
description: On their third release and second full length, Lancaster PA duo 1994! continue to develop their revolution summer influenced hyperactive post hardcore sound. While still delivering the frantic, anthemic punk that they are known for, 1994! shows a bit of progression on this record at times to a more controlled and melodic sound, demonstrating influences ranging from Dinosaur Jr to Braid or Cap'n Jazz while still holding onto the basic framework of their style. Fans of previous releases by 1994! are sure to be very pleased with this new record. This is a split release with our friends at Square of Opposition records and is in stock now. 500 copies were pressed in total.

name: Raw Nerves | We Must Be Dreaming 7"
description: RAW NERVES are a political hardcore band from Portland OR and carry on the NWHC tradition of dark, fast and heavy hardcore. Their sound lies somewhere between Poison Idea, Citizens Arrest, Left For Dead and Japanese hardcore like Bastard. Raw punk mixed with metallic riffs with touches of bleak melody scattered throughout. RAW NERVES features members of Forced March, Squalora, Protest Stagnation etc. The 7" features 1 brand new song, new versions of two songs from their very limited demo, plus a Youth of Today cover. Only 250 copies pressed on black vinyl only. In stock now.

name: Grids | White Walls LP
description: GRIDS from North Carolina play ultra-distorted, grimy, feedback drenched noise punk with crushing repetitive precision. This new LP delivers their heaviest and most damaged material to date. Comparisons could be drawn to bands like Cherubs, Pissed Jeans, Mannequin or even a punker, noisier version of Failure at times. This record is limited to 250 copies only! 6 brand new songs clocking in at just under 20 minutes.

name: Highlife | Oceanside Blues 7"
description: Highlife drop a new EP featuring more fast, thrashy, booze-soaked skate punk that could be described as Negazione meets early JFA with a hint of The Middle Class and newer bands like Deep Sleep thrown in for good measure. Snotty monotone vocals, offensive lyrics and raging surf inspired leads aplenty. The record features 6 new jams and sexy cover art from Ryan Sinz of Dios Mio. All 500 copies come on beer and seafoam colored vinyl. Preorder now, out late april.

name: Inkblot Split Series Package Deal
description:
get all three volumes of the split 7" series, all copies on white vinyl. You get:
Volume One: Acts of Sedition/Sadville Split 7"
Volume Two: Northless/Protestant Split 7"
Volume Three: Antilles/Staph Split 7"
all for only $12.00 ppd save a dollar and get all three.

name: Volume 3| Antilles/Staph Split 7"
description: Chicago's Staph and Ohio's Antilles meet up for the third and final volume of the first inkblot records split 7" series. Veteran band Antilles deliver three new short blasts of fast, aggresive 90s style screamo with unique intensity. Over the top screamed vocals and buzzing, jangly guitar work saturate the first and third tracks while bass driven, quieter nervous riffs prevail on the second instrumental song. Staph rises from the ashes of the now defunct Lion of the North and play urgent and frenetic chaos mixed with darkly melodic post hardcore. Hyper technical riffing  and shaky energy are felt throughout the six minute plus epic they deliver on this split.  100 copies on white with neon green splatter vinyl and 400 copies on white vinyl.

options.name: white w/ neon green splatter vinyl

name: Spires/1994! | split 12"
description: In Stock!!! three new songs from each band following up their inkblot LPS, both bands are touring together this summer as well. Spires builds on their soaring melodic chaotic sound while 1994! continues on in the vein of their Revolution Summer meets intricate anthemic post hardcore style. 500 copies on opaque blue vinyl pressed.

name: Volume 2 | Northless/Protestant Split
description: Northless delivers one new, burly, crushing, doom-laden epic ala Swans, Sleep or Big Business while Protestant contribute two brand new metallic hardcore ragers of their own for fans of Catharsis, Hellshock, or Rorschach. Both bands hail from Milwaukee, WI. 100 copies on white with purple splatter, 400 copies on white, all copies have hand numbered inserts.

name: Spires | Flowers and Fireworks
description: 250 copies on green white swirl vinyl. Debut LP from this Oakland four piece that play epic chaotic hardcore with vocal trades. Spaced out guitars and soaring melodies prevail throughout. For fans of Envy, Funeral Diner or Stop It!.

name: Mammoth Grinder | No Results
description: The follow up to their "Rage & Ruin" LP finds Austin, TX's Mammoth Grinder progressing with four new songs that exceed anything they've released to date, with a gloomy, violent hardcore with Sabbath-esque breakdowns and thick and heavy sounding crust metal-laden riffs. Fifteen minutes of music on one 7"! Think the faster moments of Cursed with Eyehategod's sludge.

name: 1994! | Thank You Arms And Fingers
description: Intricate, melodic and mathy post hardcore from this Lancaster, PA drum and guitar duo. Imagine Hoover in overdrive or Ghosts & Vodka with vocals. Throw in the revolution summer influence of bands like Embrace and Rites of Spring and you will start to have an idea of what to expect.

name: Alarm | S/T
description: Tucson, AZ's Alarm present six tracks of violent mayhem to this debut 7", with a style that brings to mind bands like Gehenna, Pig Destroyer, Fall Silent, Backstabbers Inc. and Napalm Death.

name: Faithealer | Bound And Chained
description: Bringing a dark, doomy and sludgy approach to their hardcore with trading male and female vocals, Faithealer bring seven tracks to this debut release. Members have done time in bands like Hatred Surge, Mammoth Grinder and Total Abuse.

name: Volume One | Sadville/Acts Of Sedition split
description: Sadville delivers a brand new song in three parts which showcases these Tennessee ragers' southern influenced stoner crust metal. Oakland, CA's Acts Of Sedition combine the dark crust sounds of bands like Born/Dead and Tragedy with the early '90s political NYHC of Citizens Arrest and Nausea.

name: In First Person/Titan split
description: New Jersey Natives In First Person bring a unique twist on the mid-'90s noisy, metallic hardcore sound, combining elements of bands like Threadbare, Deadguy and Majority Rule and feature members of The Assistant, You And I and Wage Of Sin while Toronto's Titan take the elements of bands like Union Of Uranus and His Hero is Gone and merge them with Isis like drone.

name: Sadville | Make Ready The Cross
description: "Make Ready The Cross" is 8 songs from this Tennessee five-piece that play stoned out political hardcore/metal. His Hero Is Gone, Zann, Eyehategod and Catharsis are all starting points to describe the sound of this very unique LP. Recorded by Jay Masterson at the Jamroom in South Carolina. Limited edition pressing of 500 copies!

name: Loma Prieta | Our LP Is Your EP
description: Debut EP by this Bay area screamo quartet playing more straight forward fast and furious hardcore than their later material with their original vocalist davy, in the vein of Neil Perry, Swing Kids, and Clikitat. 5 songs in 10 minutes!

name: Hope Collapse | Year Of The Leper
description: After a five year hiatus three of the four members of Black Army Jacket, as well as members of Milhouse, Human Remains and Discordance Axis, have come together to create their heaviest and most scathing project to date in the form of Hope Collapse. Taking their influences from bands like Assuck, Voivod and Discharge, Hope Collapse creates a sound that is deafeningly heavy and sonically crushing all the while keeping the music rooted in the spectrum of the hardcore/punk aesthetic. Their new six track CDep, Year of the Leper, showcases the band's sonically discordant songwriting and diverse influences and music experience. Recorded by Chris Pierce of Doc Hopper, mixed by Mike Hill of Anodyne and mastered by Scott Hull of Pig Destroyer.
